intro: Tachiadenus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved tachiadenus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
